Alasan ADM Kesulitan Recall Daihatsu Gran Max dan Luxio
07 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Wira Utama, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Astra Daihatsu Motor atau ADM yang menarik kembali (recall) Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio buatan Maret - April 2019 belum berjalan maksimal. Kendalanya, para pengguna kebanyakan belum memiliki waktu yang cocok untuk masuk bengkel.
"Masih sedikit, saya lihat datanya sekitar 800 yang ditelepon tapi yang sudah masuk bengkel baru sekitar 40 unit,"ujar Direktur Marketing, Astra Daihatsu Motor, Amelia Tjandra di kawasan Senayan, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Biasanya, kata Amel, mayoritas pengguna Gran Max adalah pebisnis. Nah, persoalannya mereka mesti mencocokkan hari dengan kegiatan bisnis. Terkait itu, menurut dia, Daihatsu juga tak bisa memaksakan. Sebab, proses perbaikan memakan waktu yang panjang sekitar 14 jam.
"Tidak bisa turun langsung karena mesti turun mesin. Makanya kami inisiatif telepon satu-satu. Mau tidak, masuk bengkel dan kapan waktunya kosong," ujar dia,
Kendati demikian, Amel menegaskan bahwa proses recall sekaligus perbaikan Gran Max dan Luxio tidak memiliki batas waktu. Jadi Daihatsu selaku pihak yang bertangung jawab atas kerusakan tersebut siap menunggu. "Batasnya sampai selesai, gak ada batas waktu," ucap Amel.
Sebelumya ADM mengumumkan bahwa Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio buatan Maret 2018 hingga April 2019 mengalami masalah pada baguian mesin. Penyebanya adalah connecting rod yang diduga mudah patah sehingga menyebabkan mesin bisa mati secara mendadak.
“Dari enam laporan yang masuk, connecting rod bermasalah. Ada potensi patah yang dapat menyebakan mesin mati saat digunakan berkendara,” kata Technical Services Division Head PT ADM, Anjar Rosjadi beberapa waktu lalu.
Adapun waktu perbaikan di bengkel resmi Daihatsu dapat menggunakan waktu sekitar 14 jam. Pada saat perbaikan, connecting rod yang berjumlah empat unit akan diganti dengan yang baru.
“Kalau dihitung secara nominal, biaya perbaikain per unit (mobil) sekitar Rp 6 jutaan. Tapi ini gratis untuk konsumen Daihatsu yang mobilnya terdampak,” ucapnya.

Reasons for ADM Difficulty Recall Daihatsu Gran Max and Luxio
07 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Wira Utama, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Astra Daihatsu Motor or ADM which recalled Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio made in March - April 2019 has not been running optimally. The problem is that most users do not have suitable time to enter the workshop.
"It's still a little, I see about 800 data being called but only 40 units have entered the workshop," said Marketing Director, Astra Daihatsu Motor, Amelia Tjandra in the Senayan area, Central Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Usually, said Amel, the majority of Gran Max users are business people. Well, the problem is they have to match the day with business activities. Related to that, according to him, Daihatsu also could not force. Because the repair process takes a long time of about 14 hours.
"You can't go down right away because you have to go down the engine. So we took the initiative to make one-on-one calls. Like it or not, we enter the workshop and when it's free," he said,
Nevertheless, Amel emphasized that the recall process as well as the repair of Gran Max and Luxio had no time limit. So Daihatsu as the party responsible for the damage is ready to wait. "The limit is complete, there is no time limit," Amel said.
Previously ADM announced that the Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio made in March 2018 to April 2019 had problems with the engine. The reason is the connecting rod which is suspected to be easily broken, causing the engine to die suddenly.
"From the six reports that came in, the connecting rod had problems. There is a potential for a break that can cause the engine to die when driving, "said PT ADM Technical Services Division Head, Anjar Rosjadi some time ago.
The repair time at the official Daihatsu workshop can take around 14 hours. At the time of repair, connecting rods totaling four units will be replaced with new ones.
"If calculated in nominal terms, the cost of repair per unit (car) is around Rp 6 million. But this is free for Daihatsu consumers whose cars are affected, "he said.
